name: Causeway Coast and Glens - 7 - Woodburn Forest

ai.summary: A challenging 19.7 km coastal-forest hike combining Woodburn Forest trails with exposed coastal viewpoints as part of the Causeway Coast and Glens series. Expect rugged forest paths, hills, and long sections of open ground with sea views; designed for experienced hikers comfortable with navigation and variable weather.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including forest tracks in Woodburn Forest, rooty and muddy sections, occasional rocky steps, and some exposed coastal segments. The route can be undulating with steep ascents and descents, and weather near the coast may be windy and spray-prone.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a 6–9 hour hike; check local weather and sea conditions; tell someone your route and expected finish time; carry a map, compass, or GPS; stay on marked paths; beware slippery mud and exposed drops, especially near viewpoints; be prepared for sudden weather changes, wind, and cold; bring sufficient water and energy food; keep to safe distances from cliffs and fragile habitats; pack out all rubbish; dogs should be under control where required.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate layers (waterproof jacket, hat, gloves if needed)
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 litres)
Map and compass or GPS device; fully charged phone with offline maps
Lightweight rain cover or pack rain protection
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April–October) for longer daylight and milder weather; winter hikes are possible but require careful planning due to mud, high winds, and limited daylight.

seo.title: Causeway Coast and Glens: Woodburn Forest Walk (19.7 km, Hard) – Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the 19.7 km Causeway Coast and Glens – Woodburn Forest route. A hard coastal hike featuring forest trails, elevation, and stunning sea views in the UK.
seo.h1: Woodburn Forest: Causeway Coast and Glens Route 7 – 19.7 km Hard Coastal Hike
